results.title: From copse to quarry
results.creator_credit: Philippe LeClerc, Elphin Lloyd-Jones, John Mills, BBC and EBU
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Animals of Farthing Wood”.
Another dazzling animated adventure for the animals of Farthing Wood. “Are you telling me that you don’t want to go on to White Deer Park?” asks Badger of the tiny fieldmice who have decided not to continue on the journey to the nature reserve. The animals are less than half way through their journey but already their fearless leader, Fox is missing, presumed drowned. It’s no surprise that morale among the animals is at an all-time low. So much as everyone loves and trusts Badger, it will need all of his strength and authority to keep the animals together, when even he must secretly doubt whether they will ever reach their destination safely… and if they do make it, will the cost have been too high?

results.title: The Koala
results.creator_credit: Vincent O'Donnell, John Shaw, Anthony Buckley and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Prior to the 1920’s the koala was in danger of becoming extinct in Australia because it was unprotected. This film looks at the koala, its biological characteristics and the various types of species which are determined by its climatic region in Eastern Australia. Those features which make the koala particularly adaptable to its territorial environment are described and its life cycle is surveyed. Photography by Dean Semler.

results.title: The Journey of Natty Gann
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Kagan, Mike Lobell and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: America is in the depths of the Great Depression. Families are broken apart when far away jobs beckon. A courageous young girl confronts overwhelming odds when she embarks on a cross-country search for her father. During her extraordinary odyssey, she forms a close bond with a magnificent protective wolf, and a hardened drifter. Stars Meredith Salenger, John Cusack, Ray Wise, Laine Kazan.

results.title: The Loom never stops : a conversation with Thomas Ladgrove
results.creator_credit: Thomas Ladgrove and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: When Thomas Ladgrove started work at Brintons carpet factory in 1967, he was a ward of the state. He eventually started working with the loom and became the youngest weaver in Australia and England at age 18. He describes his work on the loom as well as staff morale when it became clear that Brintons was suffering, the subsequent rumours and worry and then the closure when the announcement to cease operations was made.

results.title: The Animals of Farthing Wood
results.creator_credit: Philippe LeClerc, Elphin Lloyd-Jones, John Mills, BBC and EBU
results.brief_description: This is a series of animated films about the animals of Farthing Wood and their journey. They set off on a very long journey, full of adventure and excitement. Based on the bestselling books of Colin Dann.

constellations_other.name: Make it cute, make them think
constellations_other.description: Cartoons and anime are known for their dynamic and vibrant visuals, but beneath the cuteness they can also deliver powerful environmental messages and address the climate crisis.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Philippe LeClerc, Elphin Lloyd-Jones, John Mills, BBC and EBU
results.description: This is a series of animated films about the animals of Farthing Wood and their journey. Kestrel brings news that the humans are filling in the pond, and with no source of water, they would surely die. Toad advises that they should head for the nature reserve at White Deer Park. They set off on a very long journey, full of adventure and excitement. Based on the bestselling books of Colin Dann.
description_for_label: This is a series of animated films about the animals of Farthing Wood and their journey. Kestrel brings news that the humans are filling in the pond, and with no source of water, they would surely die. Toad advises that they should head for the nature reserve at White Deer Park. They set off on a very long journey, full of adventure and excitement. Based on the bestselling books of Colin Dann.

results.title: Long term employment
results.creator_credit: Michael Farquhar and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Michael Farquhar walked into Brintons to leave his details at reception. The same day he had and interview and got a job. In his time there, he moved through many different areas and went through many life changes, from renting an appartment to marriage, owning a home and raising a family. When Brintons closed in 2008, Michael had worked there for 21 years. He talks about what it was like to work there, in the good and bad times.

results.title: Boy from the block
results.creator_credit: Jeffrey Robertson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Jeffery Robertson grew up in a tough neighbourhood where survival was a daily imperative. Later on in life, this survival instinct would kick in to fight discrimination in the community and to feed his will to live.

results.title: The Kiss
results.brief_description: Sue and Bob haven’t had sex in ages, much to the chagrin of Sue (Zoe Carides), but not Bob (Peter Brown), who would rather spend time fixing the car. Bob gets more than he bargained for when his gay, next door neighbour (Hugo Weaving) offers to assist in the car’s repair. (Awards: Winner Best Comedy and Best Score, TropFest Film Festival, 1998)

results.title: Geelong TCUFA : weaving and winding : more than a job : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Five employees of carpet manufacturer Brintons and Textile Clothing and Footwear Union tell about their lives before, during and after working at Brintons. The factory closed in June 2008, leaving 100 people without jobs.
